title: MS Word - logo format?
content:
I'm creating a Word template for a newsletter, but it rasterizes my vector art. I tried wmf and emf, in addition to pdf/eps, but they print with wierd artifacts.

Any ideas on how to print vector art with Word?
author: Frode Bo Helland

comments.content: I tried to deal with WMF files in the past and could never really get them to behave either. I don't know if more recent versions of Word can accept other vector formats or not. The stock solution was usually just to create high-res bitmaps of the vector work for the person to input into MS Word (which, of course, made it impossible to make slim PDF files for email purposes...)
Thanks. I went with a psd.
I would use a high res PNG (300 dpi or higher). PNG is supported well by the Microsoft Office line and it also supports transparency with little to no artifacts.
